senses.synonym: 03673393-n (a metallic conductor that is attached to a high point and leads to the ground; protects the building from destruction by lightning);10281880-n (someone who is a frequent target of negative reactions and serves to distract attention from another)

relations.target: damage=00403900-n (the act of damaging something or someone);00745429-n (any harm or injury resulting from a violation of a legal right);07354253-n (loss of military equipment);07435370-n (the occurrence of a change for the worse);13324337-n (the amount of money needed to purchase something; \""the price of gasoline\""; \""he got his new car on excellent terms\""; \""how much is the damage?\"");00259743-v (inflict damage upon; \""The snow damaged the roof\""; \""She damaged the car when she hit the tree\"");00589255-v (suffer or be susceptible to damage; \""These fine china cups damage easily\""
protect=01130619-v (shield from danger, injury, destruction, or damage; \""Weatherbeater protects your roof from the rain\"");01132136-v (use tariffs to favor domestic industry

ground=00638550-v (use as a basis for; found on; \""base a claim on some observation\"");00832309-v (instruct someone in the fundamentals of a subject);01295137-v (connect to a ground; \""ground the electrical connections for safety reasons\"");01307604-v (fix firmly and stably; \""anchor the lamppost in concrete\"");01368058-v (cover with a primer; apply a primer to);01409010-v (hit onto the ground);01409166-v (hit a groundball; \""he grounded to the second baseman\"");01409338-v (throw to the ground in order to stop play and avoid being tackled behind the line of scrimmage);01505293-v (place or put on the ground);01505401-v (confine or restrict to the ground; \""After the accident, they grounded the plane and the pilot\"");02026205-v (hit or reach the ground);02026332-v (bring to the ground; \""the storm grounded the ship\"");03365691-n (the first or preliminary coat of paint or size applied to a surface);03467526-n ((art) the surface (as a wall or canvas) prepared to take the paint for a painting);03467679-n (a connection between an electrical device and a large conducting body, such as the earth (which is taken to be at zero voltage));05939360-n (a relatively homogeneous percept extending back of the figure on which attention is focused);05942570-n (the part of a scene (or picture) that lies behind objects in the foreground; \""he posed her against a background of rolling hills\"");08597662-n (a position to be won or defended in battle (or as if in battle); \""they gained ground step by step\""; \""they fought to regain the lost ground\"");09201896-n (a rational motive for a belief or action; \""the reason that war was declared\""; \""the grounds for their declaration\"");09357302-n (the solid part of the earth's surface; \""the plane turned away from the sea and moved back over land\""; \""the earth shook for several minutes\""; \""he dropped the logs on the ground\"");09358146-n (material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use); \""the land had never been plowed\""; \""good agricultural soil\"");13813124-n (a relation that provides the foundation for something; \""they were on a friendly footing\""; \""he worked on an interim basis\"");14867162-n (the loose soft material that makes up a large part of the land surface; \""they dug into the earth outside the church\""

building=00912746-n (the act of constructing something; \""during the construction we had to take a detour\""; \""his hobby was the building of boats\"");01106542-n (the commercial activity involved in repairing old structures or constructing new ones; \""their main business is home construction\""; \""workers in the building trades\"");02916498-n (a structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently in one place; \""there was a three-story building on the corner\""; \""it was an imposing edifice\"");07989688-n (the occupants of a building; \""the entire building complained about the noise\""

attach=01292858-v (be attached; be in contact with);01293025-v (become attached; \""The spider's thread attached to the window sill\"");01299048-v (cause to be attached);02278138-v (take temporary possession of as a security, by legal authority; \""The FBI seized the drugs\""; \""The customs agents impounded the illegal shipment\""; \""The police confiscated the stolen artwork\"");02543752-v (create social or emotional ties; \""The grandparents want to bond with the child\""

conductor=03093163-n (a device designed to transmit electricity, heat, etc.);09972018-n (the person who leads a musical group);09972531-n (the person who collects fares on a public conveyance);14845213-n (a substance that readily conducts e.g. electricity and heat

metallic=03757468-n (a yarn made partly or entirely of metal);03757562-n (a fabric made of a yarn that is partly or entirely of metal);01531539-a (containing or made of or resembling or characteristic of a metal; \""a metallic compound\""; \""metallic luster\""; \""the strange metallic note of the meadow lark, suggesting the clash of vibrant blades\""- Ambrose Bierce

senses.definition: A metallic conductor that is attached to a high point of a building and leads to the ground and protects the building from damage by lightning
